full_text:
Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 751 Filed 08/10/22 Page 53 of 261 1193
LC6VMAX2 Kate - direct
1 Q. What was Maxwell's demeanor like when she would talk to you about sexual topics?
2 A. Her demeanor was very -- I would say that it was almost like a schoolgirl. And I almost felt like she was younger --
3 like, talking like she was younger than me, like -- which was odd. And everything was fun and everything was silly and
4 everything was just very exciting. And just everything seemed to be like a fun, silly joke.
5 Q. Within the first few months of meeting Maxwell, what, if anything, did Maxwell ask you about your sex life?
6 A. She asked me if I liked sex. She asked me, you know, if I was dating somebody or --
7 Q. You testified earlier that when you went to tea at Maxwell's house in London, you told her about your family. Did
8 you continue to tell Maxwell about your family?
9 A. Yes.
10 Q. What, if anything, did you tell her about your family?
11 A. I just continued to tell her that, you know, my mother was struggling, and that it was difficult, and that I was -- I was alone a lot.
12 Q. When you first met Maxwell and Epstein, what was your understanding of their relationship?
13 A. I understood that Jeffrey was her boyfriend.
14 Q. In the first few years you knew Maxwell, what did you understand to be Maxwell's job?
15 SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300
DOJ-OGR-00012804

1 Q. What was Maxwell's demeanor like when she would talk to you about sexual topics?
2 A. Her demeanor was very -- I would say that it was almost like a schoolgirl. And I almost felt like she was younger --
3 like, talking like she was younger than me, like -- which was odd. And everything was fun and everything was silly and
4 everything was just very exciting. And just everything seemed to be like a fun, silly joke.
5 Q. Within the first few months of meeting Maxwell, what, if anything, did Maxwell ask you about your sex life?
6 A. She asked me if I liked sex. She asked me, you know, if I was dating somebody or --
7 Q. You testified earlier that when you went to tea at Maxwell's house in London, you told her about your family. Did
8 you continue to tell Maxwell about your family?
9 A. Yes.
10 Q. What, if anything, did you tell her about your family?
11 A. I just continued to tell her that, you know, my mother was struggling, and that it was difficult, and that I was -- I was alone a lot.
12 Q. When you first met Maxwell and Epstein, what was your understanding of their relationship?
13 A. I understood that Jeffrey was her boyfriend.
14 Q. In the first few years you knew Maxwell, what did you understand to be Maxwell's job?
